metric.description: A numerical value between 0 and 10, indicating the effectiveness of the overall security incident response and recovery capability.
metric.name: Response Score

metric.description: A numerical value between 0 and 10, indicating the effectiveness of the overall protective controls in a target system.
metric.name: Protection Score

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the effectiveness of network perimeter protection controls. The security controls in place for perimeter protection are measured and balanced with the risk level associated with the control. These are controls on network access points (wired or wireless), and for internet traffics through the perimeter (http proxy, email filter, etc.).
metric.name: Network Perimeter Protection Score

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the effectiveness of the access control in a network. The status of access control is calculated with the respect to the network connectivity and proximity, capturing the control in place through network design as well as access control to a device itself.
metric.name: Core Network Access Control Score

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the vulnerability control in a network. The risk of a vulnerability is calculated with the respect to the network connectivity and proximity, capturing the controls in place through network design as well as patching.
metric.name: Core Network Vulnerability Control Score

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the level of situational awareness and effectiveness of threat intelligence management.
metric.name: Threat Awareness Score

metric.description: It is the average Asset Connectivity of all assets in a target network. Asset Connectivity represents the degree of connectivity within a network. Generally higher asset connectivity is associated with higher risk.
metric.name: Mean Asset Connectivity

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the effectiveness of incident response program. This score relies heavily on the accurate incident response/tracking data.
metric.name: Incident Response Score

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the effectiveness of end-point device protection controls. The security controls in place for end-point protection for both stationary and mobile end-points are measured and balanced with the risk level associated with the controls. These include anti-malware software configuration, mobile device management and host-based firewall management.
metric.name: End-point Protection Score

metric.description: It is the average Asset Proximity of all assets in a target network. Asset Proximity represents how close an asset is logically located to a hostile network. A lower proximity indicates higher risk.
metric.name: Mean Asset Proximity to Hostile Network

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the effectiveness of physical access controls. The security controls in place for physical access control are measured and balanced with the risk level associated with the controls. Number of people with the physical access, authorization of access, and controls in place to prevent unauthorized access are among the considerations in measuring the effectiveness.
metric.name: Physical Access Control Score

metric.description: It is the average Asset Vulnerability Risk Score of all assets in a target network. The Asset Vulnerability Risk Score is the sum of the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) of all vulnerabilities discovered in the asset. A high Asset Vulnerability Risk Score indicates high risk to the asset.
metric.name: Mean Network Vulnerability Risk Score

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the effectiveness of human security components. The frequency and completeness of security awareness training, phishing test performance, number of incidents involving social engineering, and number of incidents first detected by employee or other personnel.
metric.name: Human Security Score

metric.description: It is the average Asset Vulnerability Risk Score of all assets in a target network. The Asset Vulnerability Risk Score is the sum of the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) of all vulnerabilities discovered in the asset. A high Asset Vulnerability Risk Score indicates high risk to the asset.
metric.name: Mean Asset Vulnerability Risk Score

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the effectiveness of threat detection in both technical and procedural perspectives. This score relies heavily on the accurate incident response, tracking data.
metric.name: Threat Detection Score

metric.description: It is the average Physical Access Control Score of all assets in a network. The Physical Access Control Score represents the effectiveness of physical access controls for the asset.
metric.name: Mean Physical Access Control Score

metric.description: It is the average Data Integrity Score for all databases in a target network. The Data Integrity Score represents the extent of controls against unauthorized or accidental modification of the data stored in the database.
metric.name: Mean Data Integrity Score

metric.description: It is the average Data Availability Score for all databases in a target network. The Data Availability Score represents the effectiveness of controls against data loss or unavailability for the database.
metric.name: Mean Data Availability Score

metric.description: It is the average Access Control Score of all assets in a target network. The Access Control Score is higher where there is a higher degree of controls preventing possible unauthorized access.
metric.name: Mean Asset Access Control Score

factor.description: Weight assigned for active system-privileged accounts
factor.name: W-private

factor.description: Weight assigned for active shared accounts
factor.name: W-shared

factor.description: Weight assigned for active shared system-privileged accounts
factor.name: W-sharedPriv

factor.description: Weight assigned for active accounts with no password expiry
factor.name: W-noPassExprd

factor.description: Weight assigned for active accounts with expired password
factor.name: W-passExprd

factor.description: Weight assigned for unauthorized login to the system
factor.name: W-unauth

metric.description: It is the average Access Point Protection Score of all access points in a target network. The Access Protection Score must be calculated first for each access point from the numerical value representing security controls and risk associated with the access point.
metric.name: Mean Access Point Protection Score

factor.description: Weight assigned for connection drop rate
factor.name: W-dropRate

factor.description: Weight assigned for network access control
factor.name: W-nac

metric.description: It is the average Data Confidentiality Score for all databases in a target network. The Data Confidentiality Score represents the effectiveness of controls against the unauthorized disclosure of data stored in the database.
metric.name: Mean Data Confidentiality Score

metric.description: It is the average Network Access Control Score of all assets in a target network. This value represents the Asset Access Control Score augmented by the Asset Connectivity and Asset Proximity to Hostile Network. A Higher Network Access Control Score indicates a higher degree of control and lower risk.
metric.name: Mean Network Access Control Score

metric.description: It is the average Wireless Access Point Protection Score of all wireless access points in a target network. The Wireless Access Protection Score must be calculated first for each wireless access point from the numerical value representing security controls and risk associated with the wireless access point.
metric.name: Mean Wireless Access Point Protection Score

factor.description: Weight assigned for connection drop rate
factor.name: W-dropRate

factor.description: Weight assigned for network access control
factor.name: W-nac

factor.description: Weight assigned for wireless antenna type
factor.name: W-atype

factor.description: Weight assigned for wireless frequency hoping
factor.name: W-freq

metric.description: It is the numeric value indicating the effectiveness of security control involving human agents. Security awareness of individuals handling cyber assets and the security test results are considered in calculating this score.
metric.name: Mean Human Security Score

metric.description: It is the numerical value representing the effectiveness of security controls on the stationary end-point.
metric.name: Mean Stationary End-Point Protection Scoref

factor.description: Weight assigned for anti-virus signature update frequency
factor.name: W-update

factor.description: Weight assigned for anti-virus scan frequency
factor.name: W-scan

factor.description: Weight assigned for proportion of applications exempt from anti-virus scan
factor.name: W-app

factor.description: Weight assigned for files/folders/drives exempt from anti-virus scan
factor.name: W-file

metric.description: It is the average Internet Traffic Protection Score of all internet traffic filtering devices in a target network. The score represents the extent of internet traffic controls in place such as DNS filtering, email filtering and web proxies.
metric.name: Mean Internet Traffic Protection Score

factor.description: Weight assigned for social network sites allowed
factor.name: W-sns

factor.description: Weight assigned for web proxy rate
factor.name: W-proxy

factor.description: Weight assigned for private email access
factor.name: W-priveMail

factor.description: Weight assigned for private cloud storage
factor.name: W-cloud

factor.description: Weight assigned for number of spams detected
factor.name: W-spam

factor.description: Weight assigned for phishing email detected
factor.name: W-phishing

factor.description: Weight assigned for malware email detected
factor.name: W-malware

factor.description: Weight assigned for phishing emails missed
factor.name: W-phishingMiss

factor.description: Weight assigned for malware emails missed
factor.name: W-malwareMiss

factor.description: Weight assigned for data lost or leaked through email
factor.name: W-dataloss

metric.description: It is the numerical value representing the effectiveness of security controls on the mobile end-point.
metric.name: Mean Mobile End-Point Protection Score

metric.description: The average time in days from the first occurrence of an incident to the first discovery of the incident. The day of first occurrence is usually found after the discovery through investigation.
metric.name: Mean Time to Discovery

metric.description: The average time in days from the discovery of an incident to the first action taken.
metric.name: Mean Time to First Action

metric.description: The average time in days between two incidents.
metric.name: Mean Time between Incidents

metric.description: It is the average time in days from the discovery of an incident to the containment of the incident.
metric.name: Mean Time to Containment

metric.description: The average time in days from the day threat intelligence warning is received to the day the first action was taken by the receiving organization.
metric.name: Mean Time from Intelligence to Action

metric.description: The average time in days from the day threat intelligence warning is received to the day the organization completed the protective action.
metric.name: Mean Time from Intelligence to Protection

metric.description: It is the average monthly True Positive Rate for threat hunting investigations for a calendar year. The True Positive Rate is the number of threat hunting that lead to the discovery of security incidents over the number of all threat hunting investigations launched in the period.
metric.name: Mean Threat Hunting True Positive Rate

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the effectiveness of threat hunting practices. A high score indicates a high degree of effectiveness.
metric.name: Threat Hunting Effectiveness Score

metric.description: A numerical value indicating the effectiveness of data protection in a network. This is a mean value of confidentiality score, availability score and integrity score of all databases in the network.
metric.name: Data Protection Score

metric.description: It is a numerical value representing the threat/situational awareness of an organization. A high score indicates high awareness of security threats/risks.
metric.name: Threat Intelligence Effectiveness Score

metric.description: It is the average value of true positive rate for all threat intelligence sources for an organization. The True Positive Rate is the number of threat intelligence warnings that are confirmed to lead to security incidents over the number of all threat intelligences generated by the source.
metric.name: Threat Intelligence True Positive Rate

metric.description: It is the average value of True Positive Rate for all security event generating devices in a target network. The True Positive Rate is the number of security events that are confirmed as genuine security incidents over the number of all events generated by the device. A Higher True Positive Rate indicates higher accuracy.
metric.name: Mean Security Event True Positive Rate

metric.description: It is the average monthly count of security incidents involving malware infection for a calendar year.
metric.name: Monthly Incident Count – Malware

metric.description: It is the average monthly count of security incidents involving stationary end-point for a calendar year.
metric.name: Monthly Incident Count - Stationary End-Point

metric.description: An average monthly count of security incidents involving mobile end-point for a calendar year.
metric.name: Monthly Incident Count - Mobile End-Point

metric.description: An average monthly count of security incidents involving physical access violation for a calendar year.
metric.name: Monthly Incident Count - Physical Access Violation

metric.description: An average monthly count of security incidents involving social engineering for a calendar year.
metric.name: Monthly Incident Count - Social Engineering

metric.description: It is the average monthly count of security incidents involving network penetration for a calendar year.
metric.name: Monthly Incident Count - Network Penetration

metric.description: It is the average monthly count of security incidents involving malicious email for a calendar year.
metric.name: Monthly Incident Count - Malicious Email

metric.description: It is the average monthly count of security incidents involving malicious URL for a calendar year.
metric.name: Monthly Incident Count - Malicious URL

metric.description: It is the average monthly count of security incidents involving data leak or loss for a calendar year.
metric.name: Monthly Incident Count - Data Leak/Loss

metric.description: It is the average time in days from the discovery of an incident to the complete recovery from the incident.
metric.name: Mean Time to Recovery

metric.description: It is the ratio of theat alerts in the Threat Alert Table that have completed their action/response.
metric.name: Threat Intelligence Actionable Rate

metric.description: The count of threat intelligence received by an organization.
metric.name: Count - Threat Intelligence

metric.description: The count of threat hunting investigations.
metric.name: Incident Count - Threat Hunting Investigation

metric.description: It is the count of missed security incidents. Missed security incidents include the incidents first noticed by malfunction of device, non-security staff report, compromise notification, adversary notification or public disclosure.
metric.name: Incident Count - Missed Security Incidents

metric.description: It is the count of incidents, first detected by non-security staff reporting.
metric.name: Incident Count - Non-Security Staff Reporting

metric.description: It is the count of high severity security incidents.
metric.name: Incident Count - High Severity

metric.description: It is the average email server filtering score representing the extent and effectiveness of the email server filters.
metric.name: Mean Email Server Filtering Score

metric.description: It is the average web proxy score representing the extent and effectiveness of the web proxies.
metric.name: Mean Web Proxy Score

metric.description: A numerical value between 0 and 10, indicating the effectiveness of the overall detective controls in a target system.
metric.name: Detection Score

E01.columnName: Device ID of event generating system

A05.columnName: Outbound connection to non-secure network (applicable to a protected network without internet connection)

A06.columnName: Inbound connection from non-secure network (applicable to a protected network without internet connection)

A07.columnName: Distance from the non-secure network (applicable to a protected network without internet connection)

A11.columnName: Number of active shared accounts (shared password or no password)

A12.columnName: Number of active shared system-privileged accounts

A13.columnName: Number of active user accounts with no password expiry

A14.columnName: Number of active user accounts with expired password

A15.columnName: Number of total users who can login to the system

A16.columnName: Number of total users who are authorized to login to the system

A17.columnName: Physical: Number of people who are authorized to access the asset (can touch)

A18.columnName: Physical: Number of people who can access the asset without force

A19.columnName: Physical: Number of physical barriers to the asset from the closest public location

D04.columnName: Mean Network Access Control Score of hosting assets

D05.columnName: Mean Network Vulnerability Control Score of hosting assets

B02.columnName: Number of personnel who participated in social engineering test

B03.columnName: Failure rate on last email phishing test

B04.columnName: Number of organizations directly providing threat intelligence under contract/agreement

B05.columnName: Number of organizations directly providing threat intelligence informally

T07.columnName: Number of employees trained for threat hunting

T08.columnName: Number of threat hunting investigation per month

M01.columnName: Email: Number of total inbound emails per day

M02.columnName: Email: Number of total outbound emails per day

M03.columnName: Email: Number of filtered emails per day

M04.columnName: Email: Number of spams detected per week

M05.columnName: Email: Number of phishing attempts detected per week

M06.columnName: Email: Number of malware detected per week

M07.columnName: Email: Number of spams reported by the user per week

M08.columnName: Email: Number of phishing attempts reported by the user per week

M09.columnName: Email: Number of malware reported by the user per week

M10.columnName: Email: Number of outbound email with sensitive data - detected per week
